Geo-6¶

Links for data directories.¶

Here is the link to access data directory:

Parameters.¶

The following parameters are used:

Name

Parameter

n_r

256

n_theta

768

aspect_ratio

3.50E-01

shell_depth

1.00E+00

chebyshev

.true.

rotation

.True.

magnetism

.true.

viscous_heating

.false.

ohmic_heating

.false.

Ekman_Number

1.00E-06

Prandtl_Number

1.00E+00

Magnetic_Prandtl_Number

1.00E+00

Rayleigh_Number

3.00E+09

Modified_Rayleigh_Number

-1.00E+00

no_slip_boundaries

.true.

fix_tvar_bottom

.true.

T_bottom

1.00E+00

fix_dtdr_bottom

.DEFAULT.

dTdr_bottom

0.00E+00

fix_tvar_top

.true.

T_top

0.00E+00

fix_dtdr_top

.false.

dTdr_top

0.00E+00

reference_type

1

heating_type

0

poly_n

-1.00E+30

poly_Nrho

-1.00E+30

gravity_power

1.00E+00

dimensional

.false.

hyperdiffusion

.true.

hyperdiffusion_alpha

3.00E+00

hyperdiffusion_beta

6.00E+00

Avaiable data.¶

The following data for analysis are aviable:

Description

Folder

Zonal means

AZ_Avgs

Checkpoints to restart

Checkpoints

Equatorial section (z = 0)

Equatorial_Slices

Averaged fields over the domain

G_Avgs

Averaged fields over spherical shells

Shell_Avgs

Fields at specific radius

Shell_Slices

Spherical harmonics coefficients at specific radius

Shell_Spectra

Examples of visualized images.¶

Time evolution of kinetic energy density \(E_{kin} = \frac{1}{2} v^{2}\) in the spherical shell as function of time normalized by the magnetic diffusion time \(\tau_{\eta} = L^{2} / \eta\).

Time evolution of magnetic energy density \(E_{mag} = \frac{1}{2Pm E} B^{2}\) in the spherical shell as function of time normalized by the magnetic diffusion time \(\tau_{\eta} = L^{2} / \eta\).

Radial magnetic field \(B_r\) at the outer boundary \(r = r_o\).

\(z\)-component of the magnetic field \(B_z\) at the equatorial plane \(z = 0\).

Radial velocity \(u_r\) at the equatorial plane \(z = 0\).

Magnetic energy density spectra as a function of spherical harmonic degree \(l\).

Kinetic energy density spectra as a function of spherical harmonic degree \(l\).
